author: Cameron Tate (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Clarksville falls on homecoming
text: slideshow CLARKSVILLE â€” After starting optimistically with a helicopter landing on the 50-yard line, the Clarksville Panthers homecoming ended with a 41-26 loss to the Maumelle Hornets on Friday at Metheny Field. After a four-play drive in their own backfield, Clarksville turned the ball over to Maumelle, who responded with a five-play, 26-yard drive which resulted in the first touchdown of the game. The PAT was good, bringing the score to 7-0 for Maumelle with 7:18 left in the first quarter.Clarksville pushed all the way to the goal line with a 12-play drive but turned the ball over due to several back-to-back incomplete passes around the five-yard line with four minutes left in the quarter.The Hornets scored on a 14-play, 88-yard drive to make it 13-0 after a missed PAT kick.Clarksville scored its first touchdown on the ensuing possession on a seven-play drive. The Panthers hit the PAT to pull within 13-7.The Hornets scored in the third quarter with a 69-yard run by Cory Jones to go up 20-7 after the PAT.The Panthers responed on their next offensive play when quarterback Mason Schucker completed a pass to Keonnis Graves, who ran it in for a 50-yard touchdown. The Panthers missed the PAT to leave the score at 20-13.After forcing the punt, Clarksville tied the game 20-20 with 3:22 left in the third quarter after Jared White ran across the goal line from the 6-yard line. After running the kick to the 40-yard line, the Hornets Payton Stevens scored a TD on a 60-yard run. The successful PAT put Maumelle up 27-20.Clarksville maintained possession of the ball for an eight-play drive that ran out the clock on the third quarter. The Panthers started the fourth quarter strong with a 10-yard TD pass to Graves on the first play, making the score 27-26, Maumelle. The Panthers missed the PAT and were unable to knot the score.Maumelle came back with yet another TD after only a four-play drive to make it 33-26 after the PAT.Clarksville tried to come back, but only managed to turn the ball over after four plays. The Hornets took advantage of the opportunity and scored the final TD of the game.The Panthers will travel to Farmington on Friday.
